bounty.translation[0].definitions[0].def: an amount of money that is given to someone by the government as a reward for doing something, especially catching or killing a criminal
bounty.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: a notorious cattle rustler with a bounty on his head
bounty.translation[0].definitions[1].def: food or wealth that is provided in large amounts
bounty.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: People came from all over the world to enjoy Americaâ€™s bounty.
bounty.translation[1].definitions[0].def: a kind of chocolate bar containing coconut, sold in the UK
bounty.translation[2].definitions[0].def: a British naval ship on which there was a famous mutiny (=when the ordinary sailors take control of a ship by force) in the Pacific Ocean in 1789. The sailors, led by an officer called Fletcher Christian, took power from Captain William Bligh, and made him leave in a small boat. There have been many books and films about this story, including the film Mutiny on the Bounty.
